intro: Aeschynomene evenia var. serrulata, commonly known as the serrated aeshynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments. It has been used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its potential in soil improvement due to its nitrogen-fixing abilities.
